Lars (Lunar Astronaut Revival System) was a cardiac massage device designed to revive astronauts in their spacesuits. 
With our prototype we participated in the [Asclepios--Mission 2](https://asclepios.ch/de/asclepios-ii-5/). For this, a small team went to Lausanne. 
For 2023/24 we plan to participate in the competition again. 
This project is especially suitable for beginners and we are looking forward to your participation.

<div id="slideshow">
  <button id="prevButton"><</button>
  <button id="nextButton">></button>
  <!-- put all images here that should be available in the slideshow -->
  <img class="slideshow-img" src="Lars_1.png" >
  <img class="slideshow-img" src="Lars_0.png" >
  <img class="slideshow-img" src="Lars_3.png" >
  <img class="slideshow-img" src="Lars_2.png" >
  <style>
    #slideshow {
      position: relative;
      width: 80%;
      overflow: hidden;
    }
    #prevButton, #nextButton {
      position: absolute;
      top: 0;
      background: #0003;
      color: #fffa;
      border: none;
      font-size: 50px;
      height: 100%;
    }
    #prevButton {left: 0;}
    #nextButton {right: 0;}
    #prevButton:hover, #nextButton:hover {background: #0007;}
    .slideshow-img {
      width:100%;
      display: none;
    }
  </style>
  <script>
    const images = document.getElementsByClassName('slideshow-img');
    let index = 0;
    function switch_image(x) {
      return () => {
        images[index].style.display = 'none';
        index = (index + x + images.length) % images.length;
        images[index].style.display = 'block';
      }
    }
    document.getElementById('prevButton').addEventListener('click', switch_image(-1));
    document.getElementById('nextButton').addEventListener('click', switch_image(1));
    switch_image(0)();
  </script>
</div>
